creditline: Gift of funds from Nakazawa Noriko in memory of her great-grandfather Fukuda Kodōjin
description: leaf-shaped lacquer tray, deep mahogany in color; inscriptions in black in in C and on CL; underside is uncoated bamboo, and light wood in color
text: This leaf-shaped bamboo tray was made for use in sencha tea practice. Inscribed by Kodōjin, it pictures a snail. It was produced by the Yamada Heiandō, a workshop established in Tokyo in 1919 that remains in operation today.
title: One-of-a-kind Bamboo Root
